attributes.action: remove from the Children Schools and Families Bill the amendment allowing faith schools to teach sex and relationships education in line with their "religious character", as we believe this undermines the responsibility for all schools, without exception, to provide balanced and unprejudiced teaching about gay relationships.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This petition calls upon the Prime Minister to remove from the Children, Schools and Families Bill the government's amendment allowing faith schools to teach sex and relationships education in line with their "religious character". If passed, the amendment
will mean that religious prejudice against homosexuality will be able to find its way, quite lawfully, into sex and relationships teaching in such schools. The amendment has certain
echoes of section 28 and it does a serious disservice to vulnerable young gay people. Furthermore, it detracts from the good provisions in the Bill regarding sex and relationships
education.
